info.title: LMS
info.description: LMS API Endpoints to design inhouse LMS

404.description: The mentioned member does not exist

post.description:
This API will be used to update the profile of a member based on member id. This API should update only those fields which are passed in the update profile API like if we call the update profile API by passing mobile number only then it should update the mobile number field only and it should not set default values to other parameters like country of residence or preferred language . All fields except the following ones can be updated using update profile API.
All fields except the following ones can be updated using update profile API:
•	External user id
•	Email
•	Referred by loyalty member Id
•	Membership number
•	Registration Date

This endpoint will be used to issue a token after authenticating the credentials (will be set up and provided by LMS). This token will be used to in rest of the APIs. This token should have an expiry set when issued.

This API will return the points summary along with points AED value and minimum points which can be redeemed based on the asset type and business trigger category. As earn and burn rates will be different based on the asset type and underlying category so this API will provide response according to the input parameters (asset type and business trigger) and configured burn rates for each business trigger.

•	Points Summary (lifetime total points, used points, expired points, points expiring next month, total active points, total available points)
o	lifetime total points – points earned throughout the journey
o	used points – points burned/used throughout the journey
o	expired points – points expired throughout the journey
o	points expiring next month – points which are going to be expired in next month
o	total active points – total points which are remaining
o	total available points – total points which are available to be burned

This API will be used to get all the points earn and burn transactions for a member based on member id. This API will have a parameter to filter the results to show only earn, burn or all the transactions.  
This API need to return latest 10 transactions (earn/burn) in desc order. 
Note: Each transaction needs to return the request API as well against which points are earned or burned.

This API will be used to credit the points to the member’ account based o transaction value. There can be one general API which can be used for all the assets and JSON payload would help to validate the request for different assets and underlying business categories/triggers or there can be a separate earn API one for each asset.

 

Tier information in earn API response:
The earn API is supposed to return the tier of the user after crediting the points based on transaction value. This tier needs to be based on total spending in past 12 months including current transaction.

For example, if a user has a total spending of 500 AED only and falls under White tier. If this user makes a transaction of 15,000 AED in asset like education (paid term fee for example) and earn API is called for this transaction, then the API response should return the tier of the user as Silver based on the following tier slabs as total spending will be 15,500 after this transaction which will earn the user Silver tier.

 

Bronze: AED 0 - 10,000

Silver: AED 10,001 - 25,000

Gold: AED 25,001+

Platinum: Invitation Only

requestBody.description:
The request body of this API may differ as per the business asset. The request parameters against all business assets are documented in the confluence page: 

https://entertainerproducts.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DA/pages/3221979180/DoEarn+API

post.description: This API will be used to burn the points. This API needs to work in two modes which is either burn points by AED value or burn by number of points. This information will be available in redemption mode parameter as mentioned below.

get.description:
This API needs to return the details of the points redemption based on redemption id.

Input parameters
redemption id

Expected output
member_id
email
redemption id
redemption reference code
amount
currency
concept id
burn rate
points
redemption_mode (points, amount)
date_created
redemption_api_request – json object having complete redeem/burn points API request

This API needs to return the details of the earn points API call based on the earn transaction id

Input parameters
earn transaction id
Expected output
The response will be similar what is available in earn API response except is member tier changed flag.

post.description:
This API will be used to refund the points based on AED value or by number of points.

Input parameters
member id
asset category
business trigger 
transaction_id – it can be either external transaction id used when points were earned or a new transaction id altogether
refund_points_mode (points, amount)
currency
description

Expected output
member_id
email
amount
currency
points – the number of points reversed/deducted
mode (points, amount)
points_balance
date_created

Note: The transaction id can be either external transaction id used when points were earned or a new transaction id altogether. For now, let’s not build any business logic on top of it. But in case we enforce that refund can only happen against a transaction against which points were earned then we will let you know if that is the case in next couple of days. If confirmation doesn’t come back then consider that it can be a different transaction id requiring no validation on transaction id. Refer to one use case mentioned below.
Sample use case of refund

•	Assume 1AED equals to 1Points for this use case
•	A new user (with no points accrued so far) shops for some items at some store for 100AED on May 01
•	Transaction comes to the ENTERTAINER instantly with transaction id as TXN_001.
•	TEB passes this transaction to LMS with expectation to hold these points until X days like (15 days). Once the 15 days are passed, LMS releases these points and these gets available to the user.
•	On May 05 the same user goes to the shop to make a refund (partial/full) say a partial refund of 25AED.
•	System logs a new entry into the system with a new transaction id like TXN_0009 and sets its type as refund but it is not linked to the primary transaction which is TXN_001.
•	This refund transaction comes to TEB instantly and TEB calls LMS to reverse the points. As there is no association with actual transaction and transaction to be reversed, LMS will reverse the points and balance will go in negative like -25 points in case it was as partial refund of 25AED.
•	On May 15 when 15 days are passed LMS releases the points (for 100 AED transaction) and balance now comes to 75 points.

Is this the right user journey regarding refunds? Or We need to hold the transactions for 15 days and only pass the transactions to LMS when they are eligible to get the points.
For all other assets from Leasing, Sales, Education, Maintenance and Hospitality we are assuming that transactions will come to us when the payment is realized and points are to be credited immediately as soon as we receive the transaction details. So, we need to inform Aldar about the same.

get.description:
This API will be used to return system configurations like:
•	Earn rates per business trigger
•	Burn rates per business trigger
•	Minimum threshold values to burn points per asset
•	Tier slabs/brackets

This API needs to return points a user can earn against 1 AED for each asset/business trigger. This API also need to return the burn rate as well which means it needs to return number of points which will be burned against 1 AED per asset/business trigger.
This API also need to return minimum points threshold value in the form of AED value set at business trigger level. This is also mentioned in the sample payload below.
This API need to return the different tier slabs set up in the system like White, Silver, Gold along with its spending range in AED.

member_id.description: Unique identifier for the given user.

createDate.description: The date that the user was created.
